description:
> Using options to grab user input **Description:** Options are variables in Process Automation
An option can be used as user input or passed from as webhook payload
This shows a basic example of three options, and how they are referenced in both commands and inline scripts
The 3rd option shows a regex example, used to validate input
**Assumptions:** - RBA with Runner Installed OR Self Hosted (PAOP) - Linux Tested **Documentation:** [Job Options](https://docs.rundeck.com/docs/manual/job-options.html#job-options)

name: 3. Capturing Options

options.description:
The simple option allows a user to enter free form text into a reusable text variable.
Defaults can be set easily

These options can be referenced in commands as
${option.simple}

or in scripts using  @option.simple@
options.label: Enter Disk Capacity (GB)
options.name: simple

options.description: Options can be restricted to specific predetermined values.
options.label: List of available installable applications
options.name: applicationlist

options.description: A validated option ensures the entered value matches a predetermined pattern.
options.label: Users Email address in the format (name@domain.com)
options.name: validated

commands.script:
echo "Provision the following applications"
echo "@option.applicationlist@"
echo "with @option.simple@ GB storage"
echo "to user with address: @option.validated@"
